tool.name: Sens.spec
tool.description: Determine the quality of OTU assignment
tool.command:
## create symlinks to input datasets ln -s "$otu" otu.dat && ln -s "$dist" dist.dat &&
echo 'sens.spec( list=otu.dat, #if $dist.is_of_type("mothur.dist"): column=dist.dat, #else phylip=dist.dat, #end if #if $label: label=${ str($label).replace(",","-") }, #end if precision=$precision, cutoff=$cutoff, hard=$hard )' | sed 's/ //g' ## mothur trips over whitespace | mothur

param.name: label
param.label: label - Select OTU Labels to include
param.help: By default all are included if no selection is made.

param.name: precision
param.label: precision - Precision for rounding distance values

param.name: cutoff
param.label: cutoff - Distance Cutoff threshold - ignored if not > 0
param.help: Ignore pairwise distances larger than this, a common value would be 0.10

param.name: hard
param.label: hard - Use hard cutoff instead of rounding

tool.help:
@MOTHUR_OVERVIEW@
**Command Documenation**
The sens.spec_ command takes a list_ and either a column_ or phylip_ distance matrix to determine the quality of OTU assignment.
.. _list: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/List_file .. _column: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Column-formatted_distance_matrix .. _phylip: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Phylip-formatted_distance_matrix .. _sens.spec: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Sens.spec
